In a bicategory B, for any adjunction between morphisms f and g with units Î· and Îµ, the left zigzag of Î· and Îµ is equal to the composition of the homomorphism part of f's left unitor and the inverse of the homomorphism part of f's right unitor.

type:
âˆ€ {B : Type u} [inst : CategoryTheory.Bicategory B] {a b : B} {f : a âŸ¶ b} {g : b âŸ¶ a}
  (self : CategoryTheory.Bicategory.Adjunction f g),

    CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.comp (CategoryTheory.Bicategory.leftUnitor f).hom
      (CategoryTheory.Bicategory.rightUnitor f).inv

docString: In a bicategory B, for any adjunction between morphisms f and g with units Î· and Îµ, the left zigzag of Î· and Îµ is equal to the composition of the homomorphism part of f's left unitor and the inverse of the homomorphism part of f's right unitor.

This theorem states that in a given topological space `X`, if we have a sequence of sets `(s n)` such that every `s n` is a "meagre" set, then the countable union of all these sets is also a "meagre" set. In mathematical terms, a set is "meagre" if its complement is a residual (or comeagre) set.

type: âˆ€ {X : Type u_5} [inst : TopologicalSpace X] {s : â„• â†’ Set X}, (âˆ€ (n : â„•), IsMeagre (s n)) â†’ IsMeagre (â‹ƒ n, s n)

docString: This theorem states that in a given topological space `X`, if we have a sequence of sets `(s n)` such that every `s n` is a "meagre" set, then the countable union of all these sets is also a "meagre" set. In mathematical terms, a set is "meagre" if its complement is a residual (or comeagre) set.

For any category C and objects A, B with reflexive pair morphisms f and g from A to B, there exists a common section s such that fs = g andgs = f.

docString: For any category C and objects A, B with reflexive pair morphisms f and g from A to B, there exists a common section s such that fs = g andgs = f.

This theorem states that, given any topological space X and two sets s and t of X, if s is a meagre set, then the intersection of s and t is also a meagre set. In other words, intersecting a meagre set with any other set results in a set that is also meagre.

type: âˆ€ {X : Type u_5} [inst : TopologicalSpace X] {s t : Set X}, IsMeagre s â†’ IsMeagre (s âˆ© t)
